document.title: Kansas Model Curricular Standards for Library Media and Technology

ADEF2EBA8E5347F594BB4DCD1F3FD489.description: The student uses technology resources for solving problems and making informed decisions.

362CB888651D4058B12FC7D4047BDC39.description: The student uses technology resources to make informed decisions.

4AE65A633AA4405A969DAC100F0FC1E0.description: The student uses technology resources for solving problems.

9194BA3457054F0BAE79D83134A0CD90.description: The student uses technology problem-solving and decision-making tools.

C8BF17B22E984098BD2DD03B35462378.description: The student evaluates and selects new information resources and technological innovations based on the appropriateness for specific tasks.

9CE15AB3E4D54DF1B4BBDA42275B05AD.description: uses appropriate technology tools to process data.

64B713AE2695445A83F536205EE2BA24.description: The student uses technology tools to process data and report results.

A98A2A05122C458B9AD0411AFCDB9DB9.description: uses appropriate technology tools to locate information.

E2E3F4704919473E936E741962C8BBF3.description: The student uses technology to locate, collect, and evaluate information from a variety of sources.

F068A4CA00DA4C9D83C3F393CE563483.description: The student uses technology research tools.

5F2507BE7D8A4183AB917B3308C0C689.description: uses a variety of formats to communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences.

B34928ACA44946DAA9E351CCF4CB2207.description: uses a variety of media to communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences.

2526FD3699A14B8D94C0465D7B71E423.description: The student uses a variety of media and formats to communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences.

847217210D4540A6ABEB2AE78342731E.description: uses telecommunications to interact with peers, experts, and other audiences.

6301BC0E9D564DD5B408843B4F4579AB.description: uses telecommunications to publish with peers, experts, and other audiences.

63776361750242A3B13E8F540F1C38A5.description: uses telecommunications to collaborate with peers, experts, and other audiences.

2D4A41A83481457787F3351AE19F4D8E.description: The student uses telecommunications to collaborate, publish, and interact with peers, experts, and other audiences.

BF37FFBC67E44B349631F0512FA7EBC7.description: The student uses technology communication tools.

C9D29320DD6E4978AE420ED00FB5B308.description: uses productivity tools to produce other creative works.

9A3CF3A9C1B044928E8D501FF7039A66.description: uses productivity tools to prepare publications.

08570B9C2EC7432C96DDE787823F95A3.description: uses productivity tools to collaborate in constructing technology-enhanced models.

DAA2A447469046D396A6D92B073F2BA8.description: The student uses productivity tools to collaborate in constructing technology-enhanced models, prepare publications, and produce other creative works.

E67D64F374B242419C3004382A625078.description: uses technology tools to promote creativity.

6AE019BBCFF543A7934A78D595CA5324.description: uses technology tools to increase productivity.

8EB5D0F3236F4E428E3DFDCEF500F8F5.description: uses technology tools to enhance learning.

84C9ADED7EA44E2A9B9FD1CAAE549A09.description: The student uses technology tools to enhance learning, increase productivity, and promote creativity.

3D843E40191D4453A976C57981207402.description: The student uses technology productivity tools.

356BBC8016C74E44B5BEA71A22DD721B.description: The student develops positive attitudes toward technology uses that support lifelong learning, collaboration, personal pursuits, and productivity.

0D9711F451D749589D07815FD299E6E4.description: practices responsible use of technology systems.

E8C83A63B93E49F8BB64E58AC297B69E.description: The student practices responsible use of technology systems, information, and software.

DFAC996C547641CDA3A5A57581F6CDC4.description: understands ethical issues related to technology.

7BEB1FDA71D14F89AB61920B98F4E74A.description: The student understands the ethical, cultural, and societal issues related to technology.

EEF99FBF9A764D95A8E2F305D9F50DC4.description: The student demonstrates knowledge of social, ethical, and human issues.

12284015B54F4D288AC12B0AF0A4A8DD.description: communicates about technology using developmentally appropriate and accurate terminology.

59CB2D01191C4932BB2752A5B82487C3.description: uses a variety of media and technology resources for directed and independent learning activities.

2D53323019DC498995016DB6052AAAD4.description: uses input/output devices to successfully operate technology.

D3FDB82030224F218AA9414E4C234ABC.description: The student demonstrates a sound understanding of the nature of operation of technology systems.

B49B50F1E7344D109E02B0EAA8683D84.description: The student understands basic operations and concepts.

E103734ED4354E3F88B2BDF7AA404462.description: respects the ideas of others by listening, waiting for one's turn, and using appropriate body language.

AB16488FDE304D87A6CD9657F8901355.description: The student respects other's ideas and backgrounds and acknowledges their contributions.

89896B9E166C49BEB1BEB6020DF12860.description: shares information with others (e.g., show and tell).

44B10CBF65A5458A8999104C3C722C57.description: The student shares knowledge and information with others.

4528F7A78FA643EF83910CC7CD52BFDB.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and participates effectively in groups to pursue and generate information.

9398A3EB6D8845C8AEC207861CE7EF2E.description: discusses the role of ownership (e.g., author, illustrator, producer).

F5F8CB9CA149413B9D05907BA35D3FC7.description: The student respects intellectual property rights.

0A36B13E81B44E2D98D6943C81B74AA8.description: practices good listening skills, respecting what other students and teachers have to say.

A2D9AD62FCB4428CB5F8C7A201E7258D.description: The student respects the principles of intellectual freedom.

E7A01782DB8D411E9FA668FC5052122F.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and practices ethical behavior in regard to information and information technology.

30104BE25992406CAF6FCBD642452D79.description: accompanies adult/parent to library to check out materials with assistance.

DAAF790C029C4DEFBF750FC23702548E.description: The student respects the principle of equitable access to information.

0AC62203374C4023BE25168ED1EAD62A.description: participates in library programs; participates in activities that represent a variety of culture.

03AD568F3CC9444499E18E23559A30D2.description: The student seeks information from diverse sources, contexts, and disciplines.

639421D838244140AC9F3B9E2F5B8079.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and recognizes the importance of information to a democratic society.

75E95A510EBC42EC8498F439BD11BFDC.description: The student devises strategies for revising, improving, and updating self-generating knowledge.

14462335648B4274BE2AC61B3C9D13F4.description: retraces steps in a basic problem-solving model with teacher prompts.

28BA9ADDF6C245EAAE545872F9F5D0A0.description: The student assesses the quality of the process and products of personal information seeking formats.

71BF7E16FF944BC9A5FF5865C35AC5E2.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and strives for excellence in information seeking and knowledge generation.

448E2D00A8414A31A40712E7B937FA49.description: interprets a visual and/or aural message in a different format.

88E8B8BC7E3C40028EAD4302191C3B7F.description: The student develops creative products in a variety of formats.

1838BB24980441BE816EBEEA7FF0BC3E.description: is able to understand and enjoy creative works presented in a variety of formats (e.g., video, film, internet, television, and other creative presentations of information).

1EE54C5081FA4D1382011B4D7094FEE4.description: The student derives meaning from information presented creatively in a variety of formats.

185458245C174C5B9870104A5BE2D8DB.description: identifies basic emotional expressions of characters.

D00643CFC80E4066A7140D807659DEAD.description: participates in and responds to oral language development experiences.

D52E732FA6E54E69A388E87D27E51E3A.description: appreciates literature and other creative expressions of information.

6DA22D03B3B34FAA976D7E9214477DAC.description: The student is a competent and self-motivated reader.

CD41CFB671E94CFEB388CF08DA7F7477.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and appreciates literature and other creative expressions of information.

1750C5346FBD40E78F8FF035C6D8535B.description: develops (with teacher guidance) an information product.

5DCA6DB3520443199E2C02E9C8F08256.description: evaluates an information piece in relation to personal interest.

8EA672B4CDC64A5D92AAB99CE6125DA2.description: The student designs, develops, and evaluates information products and solutions to related personal interests.

1A5645C1B47C493AB080DD6DBAD13F0B.description: seeks information related to personal interest (e.g., animal, holiday, sport, or author).

655FE58773974BFB8427CA1B6C289A8E.description: The student seeks information related to various dimensions of personal well being, such as career interest, community involvement, health matters, and recreational pursuits.

8DA90F3D424042C4BBC3F7219DE94497.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and pursues information related to personal interests.

4FBCE7DABCCA4B66BEDB2B5B4E3504F0.description: identifies various formats for sharing information.

BB241DB4F9464E03BE1FCDE7C9A31D7B.description: The student produces and communicates information and ideas in appropriate formats.

0298B392A97040C9B8FDC3B6458753D3.description: with guidance, recognizes steps in a basic problem-solving model.

BC891CDFFCF84E6E8B40557F685570C9.description: The student applies information to critical thinking and problem solving.

F9843E14D9544B43B74DFEA1D075E085.description: demonstrates the knowledge and skills for drawing conclusions from open ended selections, for example, from text, storytelling, and/or oral language.

FE632D28E5A0440A862CD717C37C7810.description: The student integrates new information into one's own knowledge.

79470CA11E21446681A9527D663CF67C.description: demonstrates the knowledge and skill after listening to or viewing a selection to identify ways of organizing information.

C5341AB396EB450B968C80DDDF22CC23.description: The student organizes information for practical application.

D09EDA49FFA3420696B4E3B7712E34CD.description: The student who is information literate uses the information accurately and creatively.

B4ABC65FD07F4C1EAF26E3772D10F55C.description: determines the point of view (e.g., who is telling the story).

56E7072DFC2244598964D7CABF486C82.description: The student distinguishes among fact, point of view, and opinion.

A32F06E367B94D3E89494A111CC92E0E.description: with assistance, defines and gives examples of accurate information.

B25B71B6633444BBAABB53EE5B8250F6.description: The student determines accuracy, relevance, and comprehensiveness.

5BAEEF312E054F8BB3AD3086CC59CA5A.description: The student who is information literate evaluates information critically and competently.

B2F2C4C986044120903AF00CAA974B30.description: uses a teacher-directed problem solving strategy to locate information (e.g., The Handy 5, Big Six, and Little Three [see glossary for citation]).

E59A358B65884F719C62C7530971823D.description: recognizes the call number and alphabetizes to the first letter with teacher guidance.

0EE3688A5B8A484F8EFCA35F8C1C6481.description: interacts with media of various types and lengths to gain information (e.g., pictures, captions, text, icons, and CD-ROM).

A3A8BE073BE5412BA8867122B5F57F2E.description: locates the library media center independently and identifies sections (e.g., fiction and nonfiction reference).

D6A48ABCB39543F48A578F9675EA7700.description: The student develops and uses successful strategies for locating information.

988F1099FAC64F03B4AA73A61465A0FB.description: recognizes information appropriate to task (e.g., fiction, non-fiction).

4E709004E727497CBE3863F2025BB5DC.description: The student identifies a variety of potential sources of information.

7E9107F6F9B2435F8D086D792BBF4CEE.description: The student formulates questions based on information needs.

12142023C54D4F2896791E16F05D8425.description: develops the concept of giving credit to an information source.

8034A718B9FE4B9D918D6D6935EF288A.description: identifies the concept of classification as it appeals to locating accurate information (e.g., fiction vs. nonfiction subject areas, [dogs, farming]).

471D945508BF440BBB623C8C744482D1.description: identifies the cover and spine of a book.

1F869B6FFC0948ED880BA95C08DC4F24.description: The student recognizes that accurate and comprehensive information is the basis for intelligent decision-making.

5FB84F6FE27F4B3CBEF8A6F462A581CF.description: states the problem or need for information.

BDC3B7097F184D849C89F3DD3F22F48D.description: The student recognizes the need for information.

C231EB842CD04E138FED479231DFF04C.description: The student who is information literate accesses information efficiently and effectively.
